backend module¶

Backend of Near Earth Object Viewer program to conduct the methods to obtain the data and do calculations on them. To determine, the speed and distances of the asteroids as well as print data to specific asteroids.

authors: Bryan Wynes, Jacob Scanlan, and Raffi Jubrael date: 2023/08/04 version: 1.0.0

backend.asteroid(database, asteroid_name, count)¶

Queries database dictionary for a given asteroid name. It returns a list with asteroid data if a match is found otherwise, it returns Asteroid not found message.

Parameters

  • database (dict) – main data dictionary

  • asteroid_name (str) – actual NEO designator

  • count (int) – count of NEOs

Returns

list with data from the database, or error message string

backend.determine_threat(au_distance)¶

Determines threat level based on distance.

Parameters

au_distance (float) – Distance of NEO in AU

Returns

Message about threat level

backend.impact_date_calculator(velocity, distance_miles)¶

Calculates date of impact given current velocity and distance.

Parameters

  • velocity (float) – velocity of NEO in MPH

  • distance_miles (float) – distance of NEO in miles

Returns

date string

backend.neos_approaching(days)¶

NEOs approaching Earth within given days. It makes the API call to NASA’s website for the data about NEOs.

Parameters

days (int) – range of days for approaching NEOs

Returns

dictionary of NEOs approaching Earth within given days

Near Earth Objects Viewer
